poem:
"An Ode to the Honoured Crumpet"

Like short stacks of sunshine in neat rows,
the humble crumpets call, unassuming.
In every airy hole, mysterious potential grows,
of globules of butter, melting, perfuming.
Bought in sixes, they are but mimicry,
Only the homespun ones truly know.
To be smothered in love's ritual, a delicacy,
Brings joy beyond what plastic-wrapped doppelgängers can bestow.
